DataElement.preferredDefinition: the type of clinical manifestations of abnormal growth of cells in the peritoneum.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to clinical manifestations of abnormal growth of cells in the peritoneum.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Abnormal growth of cells in the peritoneum

Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm that affects the peritoneum.  Representative examples of benign neoplasms include adenomatoid tumor and disseminated peritoneal leiomyomatosis.  Representative examples of malignant neoplasms include primary peritoneal carcinoma, metastatic carcinoma to the peritoneum, and malignant mesothelioma.

Property.preferredDefinition: Clinical manifestations that can be either objective when observed by a physician, or subjective when perceived by the patient.

Concepts.definition: Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: ACOSOG CRF:American College of Surgeons Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a subdivision of a peritoneal neoplasm finding.
